bibl.title: Letter from Hugh S. Cumming to George A. Kellogg, August 1, 1941

div1.p: Cumming approves of the finished Cornwell painting, "Conquerors of Yellow Fever."

div1.head: Letter from Hugh S. Cumming to George A. Kellogg, August 1, 1941
div1.opener:
C O P Y
Oficina Sanitaria PanAmericana
Washington, D. C.
August 1, 1941
My dear Mr. Kellogg:
div1.p:
Thank you very much for your courtesy in
sending me the clipping from the SUNDAY MIRROR
MAGAZINE Section relating to Mr. Cornwell's painting
of “Conquerors of Yellow Fever”.

I think this final work is an exceedingly
happy handling of a rather difficult historic incident
from a personnel standpoint. I shall appreciate very
much having the reproduction which you state that you
will be good enough to send me in September.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, (signed) Hugh S. Cumming,
Director Mr. George A. Kellogg
Jersey City, N.J/
